metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26357 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: race in VT-d domain ID cleanup Xen domain IDs are up to 15 bits wide. VT-dhardware may allow for only less than 15 bits to hold a domain IDassociating a physical device with a particular domain. Thereforeinternally Xen domain IDs are mapped to the smaller value range. Thecleaning up of the housekeeping structures has a race, allowing for VT-ddomain IDs to be leaked and flushes to be bypassed.

criterions.comment: xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
